column1: Chronic Inflammation of the Nose Not due to Allergies
column2: John D, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It started my nasal passages to clear after about 12 hours.  During my 11+ day trial I had random blockages that were not associated with environment or time after treatment.  I started bleeding and could blow out large bloody scabs.  I was getting over an unrelated flu at the time.  I also had throat and esophagus that were characterized by reduced ability to swallow medication, especially large pills and capsules; feelings that things were caught in my swallow path and total discomfort with loss of sleep and feelings of panic.  I made a trip to off-hours with priority to attempt to get help for my feeling of choking to death.  They failed to find the problem. This problem seemly subsided after I quit taking the med for 24-48 hours.  Simple saline nasal spray seems to be better than this stuff and my old Nararel.  My dosage was two sprays each nostril once per day.  I reduced it to one spray each nostril my last two days of use.
